question.body: Which of the following is not a way of classifying somatic reflexes?

multiple_choice.choice: the side of the body that responds relative to the side of the body that sensed the stimulus
when the reflex develops, during normal development or after repetitive learning
whether it stimulates smooth or skeletal muscle
if the processing between sensory and motor neuron involves one or many synapses

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is the distinction between ipsilateral and contralateral somatic reflexes.
Incorrect. this is the distinction between innate and learned somatic reflexes.

Correct. Somatic reflexes only stimulate skeletal muscle; this is one of several distinctions between somatic and visceral reflexes; another distinction is the number of motor neurons involved between integration and effector.
Incorrect. This is the distinction between monsynaptic and polysynaptic somatic reflexes.

part.hint: Remember each somatic reflex would fit in several categories; for example the crossed-extensor reflex described in next section would be an innate somatic polysynaptic contralateral reflex.
